Masterclass on Food Extrusion for High Moisture and Low Moisture Products
Masterclass on Food Extrusion for High Moisture and Low Moisture Products
This hands-on course equips you with essential skills in extrusion technology to produce plant-based protein and innovative food products.

Food extrusion is a versatile technology used to produce a wide range of food products, from crispy snacks to plant-based meat alternatives. Understanding this process ensures efficient production and superior product quality.

This three-day masterclass provides a unique opportunity to learn directly from experienced industry practitioners. Whether you're a culinary innovator, aspiring entrepreneur, early-career food professional, or an expert in research and development and product development, this course is designed to equip you with both theoretical knowledge and essential skills to excel in food processing.

Learners will gain practical exposure through live demonstrations and hands-on sessions, operating FoodPlant’s 27 mm – 40 L/D Twin Screw extruder. The course combines classroom learning led by experts from FoodPlant and SIT with interactive practical sessions, offering real-world insights into extrusion processes.

Learners will have the rare opportunity to operate an extruder, a high-demand piece of equipment in food processing. FoodPlant’s extruder includes adaptable processing capabilities, supporting both high and low moisture extrusion for small-batch testing, product development, and commercial production. Conditions optimised in this extruder can be easily scaled up to larger industrial extruders, making this experience invaluable for those looking to enter the industry or advance their technical expertise.
This course is a collaborative with
looking to discover how popular products like puffed snacks and plant-based meats are made.
exploring opportunities in food innovation and gaining technical expertise.
seeking foundational knowledge and hands-on experience in extrusion technology.
Research and Development, Product Development and Quality Control Professionals
aiming to deepen their understanding of extrusion processes for product innovation.
Students and Researchers in Food Science and Engineering
looking to gain practical experience to complement academic learning and research.
Understand the key principles and their applications in snack foods, meat analogues, and more
Learn about extruder components, screw design, and key processing parameters
Learn how an industrial extruder works, including setup, operation, and safety protocols
Experiment with raw materials, moisture content, and process parameters to influence texture and quality
Learn methods to evaluate the structure and characteristics of extruded products
Associate Professor, Food, Chemical and Biotechnology, Singapore Institute of Technology
Associate Professor, Food, Chemical and Biotechnology, Singapore Institute of Technology

Dr. Lim Bee Gim holds a PhD in Chemical Engineering from the National University of Singapore and has nearly 30 years of experience in food processing, R&D, and manufacturing. She spent 20 years at Nestlé, where she was involved in both R&D and large-scale manufacturing, playing a key role in scaling up biohydrolysate production, optimizing processing lines, and securing six patents in biohydrolysate processing technologies.

Currently serving as Technical Advisor at FoodPlant, Dr. Lim provides strategic guidance in food innovation, commercialization, and advanced processing technologies. She was previously the Founding CEO of FoodPlant for five years, where she led the development of Singapore’s first shared food processing facility, overseeing infrastructure setup, process design, and management systems. Under her leadership, FoodPlant became a vital platform for food businesses to test, refine, and scale up new products with access to advanced processing technologies.

Alongside her advisory role, Dr. Lim is an Associate Professor at the Singapore Institute of Technology (SIT), where she has spent the past 10 years training and mentoring food technologists, bridging academic knowledge with real-world industrial applications. A recipient of the SIT Teaching Excellence Award in 2021, she is deeply passionate about industry training. She designs and delivers specialized courses in Extrusion Technology and Retort Processing, equipping professionals with hands-on expertise in advanced food manufacturing solutions.
Research Engineer (2), Food, Chemical and Biotechnology, Singapore Institute of Technology
Research Engineer (2), Food, Chemical and Biotechnology, Singapore Institute of Technology

Yan Li Hui is a seasoned professional with over a decade of invaluable experience in food manufacturing. Her expertise in food safety and processing technologies, coupled with her meticulous approach, makes Li Hui an asset in ensuring compliance with stringent industry standards while optimising production processes. Li Hui's in-depth knowledge of microbiology and quality control has been instrumental in driving operational efficiency and maintaining the highest levels of product integrity. As a Project Executive at FoodPlant, Li Hui continues to drive innovation, empowering food entrepreneurs with her technical prowess. She also co-conducts masterclasses on retort technology and food extrusion, contributing to the upskilling of the food industry. Li Hui's dedication to delivering high-quality results and continuous improvement is reflected in positive feedback and the success of her projects.
Research Engineer (2), Food, Chemical and Biotechnology, Singapore Institute of Technology
Research Engineer (2), Food, Chemical and Biotechnology, Singapore Institute of Technology

Angeline is a results-driven Food Scientist with a robust background in the food industry. As a Quality Assurance & Business Development Executive at FoodPlant, she actively drives organisational excellence and excels in enhancing customer satisfaction, demonstrating a keen understanding of client needs and expectations. She was also instrumental in FoodPlant’s ISO 22000:2018 and ISO 45001:2018 certification. Angeline focuses on critical operations, specialising in quality control and assurance. Previously, at Prima Pte Ltd, she played a key role in product development and quality enhancement, particularly in oriental sauces and ready-to-eat meals. Angeline’s expertise extends to hands-on experience with retorted products and shelf-life testing, which she demonstrates when she co-conducts masterclasses on retort technology. Angeline has a Bachelor of Food Technology (Honours) and a Diploma in Food Science and Nutrition.
A Certificate of Attainment will be issued to participants who:
Attend at least 75% of the course
Undertake and pass non-credit bearing assessment during the course
Participants who meet the attendance requirement but do not pass the assessment will receive a Certificate of Participation.
The full fee for this course is S$4,905.00.
Funded under SkillsFuture Mid-Career Enhanced Subsidy (MCES)
All fees above include GST. GST applies to individuals and Singapore-registered companies.
